title: Velemark is the best Company to travel with tension free trip
review: I have been connected to Velemark Outdoors since 2015 and have attended around 3 camps. Ask me. I had the best experience in India. Everything was just amazing the staff,food, tent, transportation etc . Great Management and team work.

title: Ancient and peaceful temple
review: This temple is said to have a shiv ling which is more than 1000 years old.The temple has a lot of stairs and steep way to be walked on foot.So not that easy for aged people to reach.But the view from.top is good.

title: Tallest point of  Mukteshwar
review: Its an old Shiv temple at around 150 steps from the main road. The steps are quite doable. The temple is very serene coz of its setting amidst the trees and the height. The sound of the bells and the air make you feel very peaceful. It is a mix of stone and wooden structure as seen in many structures in this region. The base of the temple is lined with small food kiosks.

title: Mukteshwar Dham on Top.
review: Mukteshwar Dham temple is on top of the hill and it could be seen from many places in Muteshwar.Its a v old temple and drive goes through a dense forest.In the temple complex apart from Lord Shiva's temple there are other small temple of other deities.A must visit for all.

title: Revered abode of lord Shiva
review: It is a much revered dham of lord Shiva, quite popular amongst locals.

title: Om Shanti
review: A must visit temple if you are in Mukteshwar. A lot of history to it. Preferably take a guide as well. It's hardly 1 km from main market and just a 5 min walk up from the car park.

title: Nice temple
review: You reach this temple after an arduous climb over lots of stairs of a small trek from the mountain. This is a nice structure that is quite old and famous.

title: Amazing, must visit
review: Impressed with the natural beauty all around. The guide is supercool and entertaining! He had a good idea of all cool spots to hang out in the vicinity

title: good one
review: best for this place felt comfortable here .smaging place to visit with family .fantastic whether and people.want to come back again again .

title: Peaceful.
review: Well every hill station has a dam so as mukteshwar. One can spend 15-30 minutes here. Very peaceful.

title: A Really nice place to visit.
review: Its really a peaceful place to visit. Definitely you will get immense peace of mind, Feel close to nature. Temple is centre of attraction & history related to it is also great & make your belief even stronger iin religion.

title: Shiv Dham
review: One of the famous Shiv sacred place. Its a worth visit place. Very pleasant weather. You can get puja done if you want to wish.

title: Nice view of Mountains from temple.
review: We had a wonderful experience visiting Mukteshwar Dham. View from Temple is very nice. Very old temple. Worth seeing.

title: Peace  at its best
review: A place full of divinity with lush green nature all around will calm your soul within. There a trekking of 500 mtr to the temple. Please try to remain calm at the place to maintain the serenity. The temple is easily accessible by road. You can find vendors selling local fruits.

title: Spiritual Place Must Visit
review: Lord Shiva's Mandir, Where You can see small small shivllings , One Big Shivling Ram Mandir with ram Ji Laxman ji Sitaji and Hanuman ji . Unforgettable experience . Spirituality at its best

title: Gives 180 degree view
review: It is a 350 years old Hindu temple whose residing deity is Lord Shiva. This temple is located on the top of the mountain which offers the astonishing view of the meadow.

title: Very High Vibrations and a sense of calmness
review: Visited this while our stay at Ramgarh Bungalows. The drive from Ramgarh to Mukteshwar is scenic and takes round 1.5 hrs.There is a parking near the temple and from there you have climb few stairs. Amazing views of the mountains . Spend some time in solitude and meditate.Maintain and enjoy the  silence and peace and keep the area clean.While returning back one can  take the shietla route to Nathuakhan and then to Ramgarh. Great views on the way. Roads are ok and motrable. Dont forget to eat Khaddhi Chawal and Rajma Chawal at the temple gate. Mohan singh Bist is a great host and good cook. Overall a good experience. Om Namah Shivay..

title: Best Sunset View
review: There is a place from where you can enjoy the best sunset in this region. You just have to follow a trail to the left. Try it! You’ll thank me. :)

title: A very peaceful and divine temple atop of the Mystic Mukteshwar Mountains
review: Visited this popular temple for the second time but in the evening hours (my previous visit was in the morning hrs) especially to see the temple during sunset hours and evening lights.

title: Must visit
review: Visited the palce for darshan. Mukteshwar gets its name from this. Peaceful place and must visit. Priests are very cooperative.

title: Very Good And Cool palace
review: I stay With My friend in The Golden Peak, Hotel .A best Palace for healthy stay..Nature gave coolness every time.Near Dham A Fruit wala sell fresh Orange ,Lemon .

title: Serene and Calm
review: This place offers you peace. There is a shiva Mandir on top. 5-6 steps below the Mandir, there is a small Kutiya on the right hand see which is not always open for all. There is a Ram temple inside that kutiya where Mukteshwar Maharaj use to live. Now, a guruji stays their who literally blesses you with his divine energies and powers which he seeks due to meditating. I have amazing real life examples which I can tell you if you want to know.

title: Peaceful abode
review: Someone who is religious will feel different here. Peace and strange feelings. It's God Shiva's temple and the city is named after this temple. View from temple is breathtaking.

title: Divine trip
review: It was just so divine to get an opportunity to visit the ancient temple. The route is great with winding hilly roads, shade all around, aromatic fragrance. All in all a nice visit to the site.

title: Serenity ..Nature....Mahadev..all in one place
review: This place is on top of mukteshwar....the peak..where Mahadev lives..the view from there is breathtaking n one  can feel the winds blowing n bell ringing in temple.

title: Nature love
review: This place is good for those who wish to spend some time far from hustle bustle of the city and enjoy nature to its fullest.

title: Nice views from the top.
review: The temple is the main attraction of the place and visit is more or less mandatory. Better to go early morning or evening as views are good from the mountain top. Some steps to negotiate so be prepared for a 10 min steep hike.

title: Divine place, good for adventure activities too.
review: Its quite a devotional place yet provide ample opportunities for adventure sports. One must visit this place for relaxing and spending quality family time along with spiritual and adventure quotient going up. One must try camping in tents along side lot of peach, orange and other fruit gardens. In fact, while you are driving up to Muketshwar Dham, you go thru lot of fruit gardens. In all ts quite a mesmerizing place to visit.

title: A small temple
review: A small temple after climbing at least 100 steps. People make it more crowded and congested than it actually is by crowding around the sanctum Santorum. View from the top is good. Temple is clean.

title: Vacation
review: Old temple with a history but you got to hike to reach it and in between are some historical points,you can take a guide we didn’t but don’t climb the stairs initially but go from side of the stairs and hike coz there you’ll find the sightseeing points and then climb down the stairs from the temple.

title: Religius tourism
review: Mukteshwar Mandir has reference in Mahabharat. Surrounded by green Himalayas this temples offers you peace..

title: Beautiful temple
review: This beautiful temple is located on top of a hill and can be reached by a flight of stairs. It's a very serene temple. Must visit.

title: Nice quaint temple with great views at the back drop
review: The temple has a very enchanting atmosphere being set in the abode of nature. It requires one to take 10 mins. walk up the stairs to the temple.

title: Peaceful!
review: One of the most peaceful religious places one can visit. Surprisingly there are no hawkers around. A nice climb up to the different levels. I try to visit this Dham whenever I'm in the area. Definitely worth a visit.

title: Good  Temple Complex
review: This temple complex you have found in Mukteswar.This temple is in hill top and  you need to to do  lot  of staring to reach this place.

title: Local Sightseeing
review: This temple is located on a hill top covered with trees. It is a good trek to reach to the place with cool winds.

title: Sacred Temple with Nice scenic views
review: This is a sacred temple in Mukteshwar, very near to the city. You gotta be very fit to reach the temple, as the journey to the temple is on foot through the stairs. It takes around 15 minutes to reach the top. Sit down, breathe and just feel the tranquillity and awesomeness of the place. Spend half an hour in the temple and meditate. It will give you a  feeling of serenity.

title: Temple of lord Shiva
review: This temple was established by the five Pandav. This temple was established to worship lord Shiva during 12 years of forest life.

title: Must Visit Temple
review: This temple is excellent place for those who want peace and want to regain the inner peace. The only point is to get it you need to visit early morning or late evening. Staying at a closet KMVN Tourist rest house was a plus point for me as i could Just walk arounf any time. It rejuvenated me a lot and i loved spending time sitting quietly at the place.

title: Great view
review: The temple is a great view and on a hilltop. A great flight of steps to be taken..elders can have an issue climbing. Great place though

title: Devotees Heaven
review: If you are those devotees believing in 'Mahesh' and want to explore where he has been in mythical world, Mukteshwar is a signature place for that in UttraKhand. Mukteshwar is surrounded by thick DEVDAR forest from all sides. Ant that add to mysticism to Mukteshwar Dham Temple atop the highest hill of the region. Like High position of MAHESH in Hindu religion this temple, however small, looks well placed with its location.

title: Temple at height
review: Baba ke darshan ke liye jarur jaye, it has around 95 stairs but it has worth to walk thru these stairs

title: Average temple at the hill top!!
review: This is an average hindu temple at the mukteshwar hill top. A small trek is needed to reach this temple.

title: Religious
review: SITLA ESTATE –MUKTESHWAR-UTTARAKHAND INDIA

title: A small average at top of amazing Hill
review: 1. The temple itself is quite small, however you will find the pujari with good knowledge.

title: A very dirty and unsafe climb to the temple
review: This is a tourism disaster trying to cash on in Bhakti. The temple you cannot see the original structure any more as the so called restoration has covered it from all sides .

title: Steep
review: Very steep staircase.. just in case you can make it..

title: a small temple
review: its a small temple on top of hill near chauli ki jali  but very famous among ladies or parent who dont have kids..

title: Very peaceful place with nice views
review: On the top of hill, difficult to reach by kids and older people.

title: Ancient shiv temple
review: Ancient temple, rare and unique white shivling. Nice location. It is believed that wiahes are fulfilled here. People tie sacred red cloth and bells here for their wiah fulfillment. The views and breeze at this height is not to be missed.

title: peace and amazing view from top
review: hi

title: Bliss
review: One of the best place to meditate with shiva energy , very nice local food available nearby #rajmachaval etc and all seasons favourite Maggy all the time near temple.

title: Shiva Temple
review: This temple is nestled on a hill top in Mukteshwar. There are two ways to reach the temple. One is to climb the high stairs from the main road. The other one which is more adventurous and less strenuous is the trek going from the back of KMVN Mukteshwar to the Chauli j Jali leading to the temple. The trek is about 250 mtrs and is covered with Lush green trees.

title: Holy place in Mukteshwar
review: It's about 90 steps climb and must visit place in Mukteshwar. All the other visiting place are located around or nearby itself. There is not much to do in Mukteshwar. one can do small treks, nature walks and connect with each other.

title: Om Namah Shivaya
review: A visit to Mukteshwar is incomplete without a trip and pay obeisance at the seat of the presiding deity of the place..from here starts a wonderful trip on a superb walk on which Chauli ki jaali is also located... As I said. A must visit..The temple as sacred as Mukteshwar dham is above and beyond all reviews... We are way too small and insignificant to comment.... Om namah​ shivay..

title: A must visit place in those hills
review: It's just 6 to 7 mins climb for any normal. Or heavy set person... For kids it's fun... Just a few steps.. A very pious place with Lord Shiva and a mataji temple. The pujari there does puja and abbishek for everybody on request.. So just be patient and have faith.. It has a very cool weather even in summers

title: Nice calm temple in Mukteshwar
review: Nice calm temple at a very high height altitude. A must visit for people who wish to do some hike. Not recommended for old people who cannot walk. As this place is not wheelchair accessible and requires you to climb some stairs.

title: Holy
review: This is a temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Even if you are not a devotee, the place offers amazing view of the valley. There is a small team running adventure sports as well (zip line). If not taking the steps straight to the temple top, you could go around and have little trek of your own.

title: Great to be
review: Not so well managed but a great place to experience. Do go there for the view, religious reason and a bit of up hill walk.

title: A very Very important place in mukteshwar
review: A very Very important place in mukteshwar, the best time to visit this place in the morning or evening...

title: Quiet and beautiful
review: Mountain top location, walkable from KMVN and IVRI (uphill-250 mtrs only), this is a quaint little shiva temple where you can come a pray. Priests are not after you for money. You can spend peaceful time here with family. Not very crowded.

title: Old temple
review: Muteshwar Dham is an old temple have religious importance. The climb to the temple is steep and might not be suitable for elderly or disabled. Unless you are a religious person there is not much to see at the temple.

title: Very good view
review: Try to go early in the morning as crowd swells up at the later part and during week ends. Visit Chauli ki jail also during this trip

title: Enjoy the view from the top of the temple
review: Lovely view once you have reached on top. Generally it is mildly occupied so you can plan to spend some peaceful time.

title: TOP OF THE WORLD
review: Beautiful temple on the top of the hill. You will get eternal peace.

title: Beautiful Place
review: It is on the top of the hill and worth spending time. One can spend good peaceful time with amazing view.

title: OMR
review: Gud place to visit with family. Serene surroundings amazing view. Temple is also close by. One can also do paragliding here.

title: Mukteshwar Mahadev
review: Mukteshwar has very few tourist place to explore. One is chauli ki jali and other one is mukteshwar mahadev temple which is adjacent and 5 min walk from Chauli ki jali.

title: very old temple
review: nice old and small temple. there is very interesting story behind it which is also very old. must visit

title: Peaceful
review: This temple is peaceful and the approach is little sternous as the temple is at little height but totally worth the effort for the darshan and the view from the top

title: temple on hill top
review: peaceful temple on the hill. Amazing Breathtaking view with total peace and silence. In January you might get snow as we were lucky to experience snow this January. there are around 50 steps which needs to be taken to reach temple.

title: Awesome
review: Must visit. very peaceful and in woods. Good jungle track. No monkey's strange. overall very peaceful.

title: Amazing
review: No words for this place, it's pure heaven.

title: Divien Place
review: Temple of Lord Shiva. Ready to upstair about 200 steps. Surrounding of temple is very amazing. If lucky will get snow in mid dec/jan

title: Climb a steeep ascent of 400 m
review: a strenuous climb leads to the Mukteshwar temple. the trek is not suitable for elderly or those with Breathing problems. Beware of monkeys. Do not carry any eatables with you & be careful of your mobiles & cameras bcoz of monkey menace. In fact we could not enter the swami Samadhi temple bcoz of wild hungry irritating intimidating Monkeys & left disappointed after a strenuous climb. but, the trek was beautiful thru the forest & we could spot some specks of melting snow in the shade regions.

title: Nice temple
review: This temple is near Chauli ki Jali and requires some sort of trekking but once oyu reach you feel nice. They have small temples like gauri temple, hanuman temple but major one being shiv temple.

title: A Mythological Religious Place
review: There is a very old Lord Shiva Temple on which the local & the tourists have lot of faith & belief. A must visit place for all.

title: Heavenly Peace
review: years old temple, absolute quite. One can feel a place to spend some time for self-introspection and feel totally out of the world

title: Old temple in the hills
review: One can climb up the stairs from the main road to get to the temple, or take a more scenic route from Chauli ki Jali. It was a quiet and serene temple- lots of bells everywhere. Although architecturally, it did not seem very old.

title: Quiet and holy place - Loved the 15-20 minutes I spent there .
review: Quiet and holy place - Loved the 15-20 minutes I spent there . the way to the dham from Ojaswi resort was amazing - quiet an beautiful via the forest reserve .

title: On Top of the world.
review: The temple is at the absolute peak. Its old, has the Himalayan charm, is very quiet and soothes ailing souls. Once you've got divine blessings, don't miss the spectacular view.

title: Feel the Energy
review: Only in such worship places where you have to travel to a secluded place, and specifically mountain tops Shiva temple, where you feel strong energy. I'm not Hindu but felt serene sitting beside the priest praying. I prayed myself and felt a strong positive energy in this place

title: Divine Feeling
review: While being on the way to this temple we witnesses panoramic views of the Himalayan Mountain range. Temple is located at good height and the place is very peaceful. You need to climb some stairs also. The temple is not very huge. A visit is recommended.

title: New year trip
review: It was new year trip trip to naukuchiatal from there we went to mukteshwar dham temple around 50 km .

title: OK Place
review: It is ok place to visit with a hilltop temple and nearby trees. The place may become inaccessible in winters, as told by locals, due to snow fall.

title: Tryst with divine
review: Situated at a height of 2290 meters this idyllic picturesque place offers Panaromic Himalayan views. This temple is an ancient seat of divinity

title: Temple is always good
review: Ready to walk 1 km upstairs. view of mountain from temple is very awesome. very ancient temple. beware of monkies

title: Awesome
review: Enjoyed a lot .walking through ice.lovely nature. HIMALAYAS will grace you.

title: Lord Shiva temple, which is around 350 year old
review: Lots of steps to cover, a holy shrine and worth a visit. Close to it lie the overhanging cliffs, locally known as Chauli-ki-Jali. Mukteshwar is the abode of a saint — Shri Mukteshwar Maharaj ji — who lived at the Top Cottage Temple where his samadhi is. One of his disciples, Swami Sanshudhanand ji, now stays there. The whole temple complex is a Tapovan and an ideal place for meditation.

title: Vacation
review: Nice quiet place, clean and safe, fresh fruits,  quaint souvenirs. Can spend the entire day walking around

title: The place gets its name from this temple.
review: Its like any other Hindu temple. Baba ji here was surprised to see too many people visiting the temple. He said all this was because of Google. I said expect more visitors next year. A 250 meters track from this temple takes you to Chauli ki jaali.

title: MAHADEV
review: A must visit place in mukteshwar as its name is derived from this temple just in front of Himalayas. Quietest place with sound of bells echoing....

title: God Shiv Temple
review: 350 years old Shiv Temple,, a must visit for believers, its the highest mountain peak in kumaon region, serene, peaceful, great view just like God Shiv ...

title: Summer trip
review: This is a temple on the hills near nanital. This is situated on Topest hight around 7740 meters,  one who visit nanital must visit here,  actually the road to here and surroundings make happy the family. Few tea stall and snacks are available here..

title: Nice temple to visit
review: You woyuld love the serene view and the silence over there. Spend some time there to refill your lungs with fresh oxygen at some extremely beautiful place. Do not bother to take prasad unless you have to from the vendors outside.

title: good view
review: good view of surrounding area. thats all one can say. no architectrural  delight. not worth the trip......................................................................................

title: very nice temple !!!!
review: very nice temple of lord shiva in mukteshwar !!!!!!!! i visited this temple first time and it was very good experience ...  temple is very old and well maintained ......

title: Nice temple !!!!
review: this is a temple in mukteshwar . This is situated on Topest hight around 7740 meters, one who visit mukteshwar must visit here, actually the road to here and surroundings make happy the family. Few tea stall and snacks are available here.

title: Perfect Picture-sue view
review: this temple have great importance in hindu's. But from a travellers point of view as well this temple is amazing. The view from the top is jus mesmerizing, one can spend hours jus standing there.

title: Nice place to visit in Mukteshwar
review: Possibly the numero uno spot in Mukteshwar. Not only a holy place but has very good views & the highest point of Mukteshwar. Not to be missed just because of its religious part. Also suggest to take a guide to know about this place and a nice little trek in the jungle.

title: Great trek from Sitla
review: The temple is a wonderful 90 minute trek from Sitla. Nothing much to report about the temple though.

title: Topmost peak of mukteshwar
review: Serene and atop the tallest peak of mukteshwar reachable by car or best through trekking that adds another thrill.

title: just another temple
review: it is located near the Indian Veterinary Research Institute. People of age group 55+ should avoid as it is a steep walk to the temple and then 95 stairs.

title: Amazing View from Temple
review: This temple and Chauli ki Jali are located on same mountain only so plan for both.

title: 350 years old temple.
review: There is a 350 years old temple. Outside the temple you get a beautiful view of the valley and Chauli Ki Jaali.

title: Old temple
review: Though the drive to Mukhteshwar was a treat with excellent view of the mountains and far off valleys, the temple was a disappointment.

title: A highlight of Mukteshwar
review: The road ends close to the Mukteswar temple near the Inspection Bungalow. The temple itself is small and stands atop a serene mound dedicated to Lord Shiva. Adjacent to it is an ashram of saints who had come here to meditate from far away West Bengal. A short uphill trek from the road up a flight of stairs takes you to the temple. Local residents rvere the deity along with visitors from afar.

title: Tranquil and bliss
review: A very small temple which also happens to be 1 of the 2 tourist locations in Mukteshwar

title: Fantastic isolated place!!!
review: It is a renowned & old temple of lord Shiva at hills with underlying heritage and belief.The temple also offers very good view points as well as scenic beauty of the snow covered mountains provided weather is clear.The best part is one can sit inside the sanctum and meditate without being disturbed. I enjoyed the place as it was not crowded like other temples.Its a good place to do meditation & to be with yourself, away from outside world.One (must to carry trekking shoes & avoid heavy bags while visiting this place.)

title: Very Peaceful Place ...........
review: Mukteshwar temple is very old but very neat and clean place. Well maintained small campus , we stay there for 3/4 hours in the evening. Main attraction of this hill station. I request you all don't throw plastic waste here and there when you are in hills.

title: An ancient temple
review: I liked this temple because it isn't commercialized like any other famous temples. A small temple kept the way it was untouched which i think is the beauty.

title: In the lap of nature
review: This is one of the best view around Nainital.. It is like  you are at the end of mountain range and in front of you is the thrilling view of Himalayan ranges.. the view was breath taking and similar to the great canyon in US as on the edge of any side of mountain there is deep slide one kilometer..The temple is must visit as known Mukteshwar Dham and you find a different vibration just holistic.. the present Sadhu lives here since 1946 and he told that there was only rains and snow at that time in the area and hardly any vegetation.....

title: Spirituality with a view
review: Mukteshwar Dham is a historic temple with a beautiful view of the Himalayas.

title: Peaceful
review: Very peaceful place with only the birds chirping around you. Must visit the temple but the climbing the stairs could be little difficult especially for old people .

title: Serenity
review: The temple situated on the top of the hill offers a great view of the valley. One could feel lots of positive vibes coming form the temple. Kindly ensure that you maintain silence and respect other devotees who have gone their to seek blessing.

title: great vibrations at temple
review: A small temple away from hustle bustle of city and isn't commercialized like any other temple. Great place with beautiful views and perfect for meditation. Situated on top of the hill offers superb views. Temple is must visit and feel different vibration just holistic.

title: Good Views
review: Go there for the views. Its an easy walk up to the temple. However, monkeys are a nuisance. One needs to be careful with small bags and belongings.

title: God's Abode
review: A must visit for the religious minded.  Visit to the temple calms and soothes the mind and the body. Dedicated to the God's.

title: Mystic temple
review: Located almost at the end of the little hamlet Mukteshwar,this ancient temple has its own mystic charm.It hosts a Shiv temple , a Devi temple and other gods and goddesses. There is a separate chamber where there is a saint (baba) who is in meditation. Since the temple is at the top , you need to climb stairs.The views from the top are attractive , more attractive is the feeling once you complete your temple darshan.

title: God's Place
review: Nice and pleasant place within the mountains. Good View from the hill top and serene place. Would surely recommend people to visit the temple and if possible walk up to the temple from Chauli Ki Jali side. Its much more good.

title: Amazing view of the Nanda Devi peak !!
review: Mukteshwar is blessed with amazing natural beauty and the Mukteshwar Dham provides a panoramic views of the Nanda Devi peaks and the mountains around it. The Dham has a Shiva temple and it gives a spiritual feeling after visiting this place. Don't miss the Malta fruit which is a USP of this place :)

title: must visit in mukteshwar
review: very scenic and peaceful location , its a 10 min walk including some stairs also . elder might not face any problem over there.

title: Good to visit while in mukteshwar
review: Another one of temples to visit while in mukteshwar. Nice little trek leads to this temple which is a combination of 4 small temples.

title: Lord Shiva's Temple
review: One of the sacred places in Pithoragarh, this is an old, single roomed, single domed,  Shiva temple, almost 400 years old. It was originally the abode of Sh. Mukteshwar Ji Maharaj, a Bengali saint. It can be easily approached from two sides, both of which meet ahead, for further approach to the temple. One of the approach is from an arched gate on the main road, with an insignia ' Mukteshwar Dham' written in Hindi, from which steps take us to the temple. The other approach is from the path to Chauli ki Jali near the ' Government Primary School' , partially plain & partially stepped. The main shrine houses a Shivling with pictures of other Gods hung on the wall. There is also an old Ram temple before this temple managed by an old bearded Pujari.

title: mukteshwar dham
review: mukteshwar dham is an ancient shiv temple with a great natural scenery and it is a very peace ful place

title: worth visiting
review: the temple is close to chauli ki jhali and is worth visiting if you happen to be around. better take walk from chauli ki jhali thourgh the forest to reach the temple. in this way you will avoid the temple steps.

title: Abode of the Lord
review: A visit to the mukteshwar dham which is at a altitude of 7500 feet approx is a combo of tourism as well as religous outing. The temple perchead on the small hill top is said to be very old and houses lord shiva in the Linga ,  , a ten minutes insuded the sanctum sanctorum gives you such positive energy that you would want for more.

title: In the dome of Lord Shiva
review: One of the oldest Shiva linga, a must see for believers and devotees. The temple complex also has temples dedicated to Devi (Shakti), Hanuman and Ram.

title: Nice view
review: Small climb up, great view from top. Nice small simple temple. Can see chauli ki jali from here. We came in off season in August but weather was good. Not too many tourists when we visited. This is close to the daak bunglow and near ivri.

title: Amazing !
review: Amazing place and beautiful temple. Its close to Chauli ki Jaali which offers breathtaking valley views and adventure sports.

title: loved it
review: lovedthe bengali baba , he is my guru now

title: Jai Jai Shiv Shankar !!!
review: Mukteshwar Temple is situated at high altitude at Mukteshwar , about 50 km from Nainital. Start early morning , reach the temple top by 9 am. Trekk through the pine wood, for senior citizens, trekking up can be difficult but possible by resting in between. One reach the Top , Temple is serene  Divine. Its Lord Shiva tample having Durga Mandir as well. From the railings of the temple, great view of Himalayan Ranges. Mesmerizing.

title: Worth a visit
review: Very very easy to reach although on top of the hill and at the highest point. Older people can also access this temple, although with some help.

title: Good spot !
review: the temple is 1000 year old and walking up to the temple through forested trail was fun . the premise has a hanuman temple, Durga temple and a Ram mandir . I enjoyed paying homage to all these temples. There is an old Baba who resides in this temple premise who claims he is one of the two people who discovered this place. it used to be a cave before.

title: The temple vibrates in high energy!
review: 100 + year old shiva temple.

title: Beautiful Mukteshwar
review: Was in Camp Purple on an official team building 3 day interactive  and enjoyed the scenic beauty and the climate and everything the senses could imbibe. Visited the mandir and did meditations in the open morning air and  as the sun  rose and lit each peak of the Himalayan range, as the first light of dawn touched each peak it changes several colours and was a breathtaking experience. Chauthi Ki Jaali, has a beautiful views of the Kumaon valley. the natural lattices and a hole in the rock are the remnants of the battle between demons and goddess which can be construed from the lattice rock formation, we did a bit of climbing and rappelling activities There are also a lot of cottage industry stuff to shop from... A very good do it again experience.

title: solace u get
review: i have visited this place quite a few times now n found it all the more interesting every time...peace beauty ..solace u get here

title: Mukteshwar dham
review: It is old ancient tample of shive it is having a small shiv ling .as we are told by guide pandavs get moksha after visiting here only .it is quiet place

title: Give it some time.
review: The name of the town Mukteshwar originates from this place. An old temple exists dedicated to lord Shiva. One has to climb several steps to reach temple on top. It is very close to PWD rest house. View from top is good.

title: Temple near Chauli ki Jali
review: Visited the temple near Chauli ki jali. Temple with lot of bells, the kids enjoyed a lot ringing them and having kaphal - local fruit.

title: In abode of Lord Shiva
review: I had visited this temple in June 2015. You can actually feel the energy and magnetic powers inside temple. It is believed that this place has caves and nobody knows its end !

title: Peaceful abode
review: It is clearly spelled out at the temple - This is a place for worship and not a tourist place. Rightly said, two temples over there makes you realize the mysterious sense of sprituality. It is the top most point at Mukteshwar and you feel as if God is actually residing there. A must visit.

title: Temple visit
review: Quaint, secluded and less crowded. Seek blessings from the Babaji who lives there. Serene and pristine beauty all around.  After the darshan in the temple don't venture near a restaurant named red chillies as we found the food quality poor, pricey and there was an insect in the daal, the place was unhygienic

title: Peaceful
review: This temple is a temple of lord shiva. it is situated in a very peaceful place .Different sizes of bell are hang in the temple .

title: 360deg Veiw of the Himalyas.
review: Mukteshwar is a quiet and beautifull hill station 52 Kim's near Nainital towards Ramgarh. It is situated higher than Nainital at 2286 mtrs and colder also in the summers.You see a 360 degree enchanting view of the mighty Himalyas and its snow bound peaks.

title: Peaceful...
review: Must Visit Place if you are visiting Mukteshwar. It is located at small hill top and one have to climb some 50 odd stairs to reach the temple. Really peaceful and divine place.

title: peace
review: meditate ,  meditate and meditate when you are here don't say much . Pray to almighty and if get some time devote it with main pujari he is a very spiritual fellow.

title: Bliss ❤ Bliss ❤ Bliss ❤
review: Absolutely Blissful !!!

title: Really Mukti ka Dham
review: It is worth visiting & praying place, we really felt pleasure & peace to visit & worship here. We were also blessed by Swamiji. Mukteshwar dham is at very nice location, you can have a beautiful view. Swamiji has vast knowledge & can give you tips for solving problems. I think the name "Mukteswar Dham" itself is sufficient to understand that it is a place to get "Mukti".

title: A beautiful and serene place
review: A beautiful and serene place, you can enjoy a beautiful view from there....its a Shiva temple. It is the most famous attraction here

title: Air of Freedom
review: This temple dedicated to Shiv is the most important site in Mukteshwar.  A series of steps take you to this temple built on the top of a ridge. The view of the valley from this place is an interesting one or you may like to stay there for a while just to get a breeze of fresh air.  This temple is built in 2 tiers. First one houses residential quarters for the priest and his disciples. A small ashram is also there. On the top there is the main temple.

title: Excellent view of 160% angle Himalaya's
review: Mukteshwar is 52 Kms from Nainital.The place is surrounded by apple orchards and fantastic view of Himalaya'n peaks Kashmir to Nepal.There are some good Resort as well as budget hotels,one must stay there.Specially those tourist who want to relax.There is small temple of lord Shiva which have to climb up.

title: serene worship place
review: very serene and peaceful surroundings for temple...you can spend some time just enjoying the calm which is occasionally broken by birds....must visit while in mukteshwar

title: ॐ
review: Its a temple so nothing to dislike. I liked what is written in temple, which means that it is a religious place not a tourist place so kindly avoid electronic gadget show like camera mobile etc. there. Though it is not prohibited legally, at least mobile phones can be kept silent & too much of photography should be avoided. Instead of that the vision of temple should be saved in the trillions of terabyte storage i.e. mind :-)

title: Mukteshwar View Point
review: Beautiful view point of valley below and hills around, cool breeze and beautiful rock formation. Guides available at the starting point for about INR 200, they will explain about the various view points and help in taking photographs at good spots. Disappointed not to see the Himalayan range due to thick fog. Understand it is visible in the morning at about 6am this season or during Oct-Dec season or just after rainfall. However, the drive to location was very beautiful, got a chance to see the various fruit orchards- apple, peach, pear, plum. Beautiful coniferous trees and multiple ranges on hills are visible. Stopped at a small stream, kids enjoys walking on the stream and cooling the feet in the water. Important to take breaks at good view points to enjoy the drive. Activities available at destination point like rapling, rock climbing, etc.

title: visit to Mukteswar dham
review: We visited in May 2015 and went inside the temple. It is a nice serene place with the blessings of the nature.

title: Only for Believers
review: Go only if you guys are believers of the deity. Since we are not, it was a waste of time after strenuous drive on broken road.

title: peacefull
review: Gives you inner piece, contentment, and a sense of an absolute power creating & guiding all humankind at all times.

title: Old and still has the charm
review: This Lord Shiva temple is 350 years old, but is still so beautiful and well kept. You can feel the air around it is so quaint and fresh.  You can also wander around in the veterinary institute at the same time, which is also worth a visit.

title: A peaceful and spiritual experience
review: The Mukteshwar Dham has a Shiva Temple. The best part of the temple is that there is no rush . One can perform puja without being pressed for time. The priests performs puja for one's wishes . We were given full dedicated attention. The place is quiet and gives a spiritual resonance to the visitors. Views from the hill top is wonderful

title: Temple after a flight of 100 steps
review: Quiet peacful scerene templ. Peist, Swami is very caring. Temple is very neat and clean. Lots of bells which chimes with stron breeze blowing. Good location to watch sunset and have a glimpse of valley.

title: Power of prayers
review: Mukteshwar Temple - I was expecting something more grand. But the simplicity of it wins you over. the Lord shiva temple- has other deity - Hanuman- Branhma- Ganesh - surrounding it. Seems tying of bells or the cloth for wishes to be fulfilled us a new phenomenon here.  And before you reach on top to shiva temple- just before that is a Ram temple. Both controlled by different priest - who did not seem to like each other.  That was a bit of dampener.

title: Nice & peaceful place
review: Unlike other temples , this place is very calm & the devotees can offer pooja peacefullt without being pushed around by others.

title: Mukteshwar--on top of the world
review: The temple is on top of the hill and is a quiet place.

title: A pleasant visit
review: The stairs can be tough for people who have arthiritis pain, but with little effort  I think one should climb up for a visit to the temple. Its a quiet place not much crowded, except locals. It is near to the beautiful KMVN hotel.  If the weather is clear, you would surely see the Himalaya Range.Trisul and Nandadevi. I got a glimpse but weather was not good. .

title: peacefull
review: very old lord shiva temple 200 steps  heart touching  again good veiw of great himalayas nice and peacefull place

title: A peaceful place with great views
review: Once here, the simplicity of this 350 year old Shiva temple will win you over. Inside the temple complex there are numerous bells and holy cloths tied on various spots by devotees with a desire that their wishes to be fulfilled by the Lord. Views from here are just breathtaking and it’s ideal place for photography and meditation.

title: A Must Visit
review: Very silent, quite & nice place, full of Scenic beauty.

title: Beautiful views, quirky characters
review: As with many hill temples, the Mukteshwar temple has some really awesome views,

title: At great heights.
review: The temple rest at the highest height of 2079 meters.The temple is of lord shiva. The temple is again surrounded by devdar and oak tress. The place is just magical.

title: The highest
review: Above all is god, which is true at this place. The temple is situated at the highest point in Mukteshwar. It is a Lord shiva temple.The place a magic in it which spreads all over Mukteshwar.

title: For devotees of shiva
review: This is a shiva temple set up by a saint. Can't be branded as a tourist destination but a must visit if you are a Shiva Devotee!

title: See the sunset
review: Sunset was awesome with ice in valleys and sun setting behind the ranges of mountains. Temple was ok, I can recommend even not going to the temple. Just see the sunset from the round about below the temple.

title: Close to Lord Shiva
review: Its different feeling at the temple. You feel an aura around. Very Calm, Lesser crowd, peaceful. Make sure you stay at least one night in Mukteshwar.

title: Photographers' delight
review: Perched at the top of the hill, the place is a photographer's delight as beautiful view of the valley is on offer. A temple of Shiva for the devout and a memorial of a Bengali saint who took samadhi here for the curious, nothing more. Be there to spend a quiet sunset.

title: Visit to Mukteshwar Dham
review: We drove unto the shrine and climbed around 50 steps. The views from the shrine were breathtaking. The sense of peace enveloped me at Darshan.

title: NEEDS FULL REFURBISHMENT !!!
review: Not very interesting. nor nicely made or maintained. To be looked into by the local authorities. in the interest of the tourists coming in from very long.
